subject: Re: [junit] questions about junit
msgSnippet: ... Yes and no. No, because if you use C++ you will be better off with CppUnit. (Or do you just generate C++ from Java? Then the no is a yes.) And yes, because
messageBody:
On Thursday 04 March 2004 23:04, joedejin_zhao wrote:
> I am doing a research on automatice testing framework for my
> company's application. Had read the docs of junit, but still not sure
> whether it is useful for us.

Yes and no.
No, because if you use C++ you will be better off with CppUnit.
(Or do you just generate C++ from Java? Then the no is a yes.)
And yes, because you can unit-test your code.

Maybe I missed a point, why do you think JUnit may not be suitable for
your project?

Robert
